Q262.question: Which of the following economic issues is the most serious one facing your country?

values.4: Not having enough money to meet basic needs (poverty)
values.5: Prices and the cost of living are too high (inflation)
values.6: The gap between the rich and the poor (inequality)

Q101.question: How would you evaluate the current economic situation in your country?

Q102.question: Compared with now, how do you think the economic situation in your country will be in the next 2–3 years?

Q114.question: Compared with a year ago, is the gap between the rich and the poor now wider, the same, or narrower?

values.97: The gap between the rich and the poor is not a problem

Q127_1A.question: To what extent is the availability of food currently a problem in your country?

Q127_1B.question: To what extent is the affordability of food currently a problem in your country?

Q127_2B.question: To what extent is the affordability of housing currently a problem in your country?

values.3: Wealth gap between the rich and the poor
values.97: Food insecurity is not a problem in my country

Q129A_1.question: In the past 7 days, how often did your household rely on less preferred and less expensive foods?

Q130.question: Which, if any, of the following actions does your household take to purchase food?

values.1: Household does not take any of these actions
values.2: Borrow money from family or friends to purchase food
values.4: Receive food donations or rely on government support programs
values.5: Receive food donations or rely on support from religious institutions or charities

Q130.notes: Multiple responses allowed; option 1 is exclusive.

values.3: Lower the cost of living (limit inflation)

Q273C.description: Most effective action to influence government
Q273C.question: Which of the following actions do you think is most effective for influencing a national government decision?

values.1: Contact government officials on social media
values.2: Use personal connections (wasta) with government officials
values.3: Contact radio, TV, or print media
values.4: Get people interested in the problem and form a group
values.6: Participate in an in-person protest, demonstration, strike, or boycott
values.7: Start or engage with a social media campaign

values.2: Under some circumstances, a non-democratic government can be preferable

Q550A_1.question: To what extent is equality under the law an essential pillar of human dignity?

Q550A_6.question: To what extent is having basic civil rights guaranteed an essential pillar of human dignity?

Q516_1.question: To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement: Under a democratic system, the country’s economic performance is weak?

Q1014B.description: Number of working youth in household
Q1014B.question: How many youth under the age of 18 living in your household work?

values.97: There are no youth under the age of 18 in this household

Q1014B.notes: Main response is an integer count; only special codes are listed here.

Q1015A.question: Is your net monthly household income less than or greater than the median income in your country?
Q1015A.notes: Median income value is country-specific and inserted by programmer.

Q1016.question: Which of these statements comes closest to describing your net household income?

values.1: Income covers expenses and we are able to save
values.2: Income covers expenses without notable difficulties
values.3: Income does not cover expenses; we face some difficulties
values.4: Income does not cover expenses; we face significant difficulties
